Test Name: Culture Referred for Identification, Mycobacterium and Nocardia
Specimen Type: Respiratory specimens (sputum, BAL, tracheal aspirate), tissue biopsy, body fluids, wound/skin lesion swabs
Purpose: To identify Mycobacterium and Nocardia species from clinical specimens using culture, staining, biochemical, and molecular methods.
Container: Sterile, leak-proof container or swab transport tube appropriate for the specimen type
Equipment: Class II biosafety cabinet, Lowenstein-Jensen slants, Middlebrook 7H10/7H11 agar, sheep blood agar, Ziehl-Neelsen or auramine-rhodamine staining kits, Mycobacterium and Nocardia molecular identification systems
